author: benjaminchodroff
content: Does a new BLSToExecutionChange gossip get shared to all peers of a beacon node, or do these type of gossip messages go to a limited number of the peers? If we are intention is to help propagate local gossip as fast as possible to as many peers, and our node has sufficient bandwidth/resources necessary to avoid peer penalties and keep up, is there any harm or benefit in setting the target peer count abnormally high - such as 500 peers? Or, is it still beneficial to maintain a reasonable peer count - such as less than 75 peers per node?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<dannyryan> gossipsub uses the D (degree) parameter to decide the number of peers to gossip to on a topic. This is configured to 8 generally across clients. I'm unsure if it's an easy param to alter with config files or CLI params

adding more peers does not affect your target degree on a gossipsub topic
